name: Kiss of the Toad
description: Your touch becomes toxic, poisoning a creature you hit with a successful melee touch attack. The poison deals 1d6 points of Constitution damage immediately and another 1d6 points of Constitution damage 1 minute later. Each instance of damage can be negated with a successful Fortitude save. Focus: A tattoo of a toad on your skin.

name: Blackrot
description: The plant-matter creaks and writhes beneath your hand as you generate a malignant rot at its center. This spell allows you to deliver a single touch that either damages a plant creature over a number of rounds or renders a wooden weapon poisonous. When used as a touch attack against a plant creature, the spell deals 1d8 points of damage per round. A successful Fortitude save reduces the duration to 1 round. Alternatively, you can touch a weapon with a wooden striking surface (such as a club or quarterstaff). Any creature damaged by the weapon is sickened for 1 round unless it succeeds on a Fortitude save. Treat this as a poison effect for creatures immune or resistant to such effects.
target: One plant creature or one wooden weapon touched
